summary: This is a formal request from the Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) to an unspecified facility for documentation regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death, in order to update his status from registered sexual offender to deceased in Florida's records.

persons.name: Richard L. Swearingen
persons.role: Commissioner of the Florida Department of Law Enforcement
persons.context: He is the signatory and commissioner of the FDLE, the agency making the official request for documentation on Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Ron DeSantis
persons.context: Listed as the Governor of Florida in the document's letterhead.

persons.name: Ashley Moody
persons.context: Listed as the Attorney General of Florida in the document's letterhead.

persons.name: Jimmy Patronis
persons.context: Listed as the Chief Financial Officer of Florida in the document's letterhead.

persons.name: Nikki Fried
persons.context: Listed as the Commissioner of Agriculture of Florida in the document's letterhead.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the document; the FDLE is requesting death documentation to update his status in Florida's criminal justice information system from registered sexual offender to deceased.

events.title: FDLE Request for Epstein Death Documentation
events.description: The Florida Department of Law Enforcement formally requests documentation from a facility to confirm Jeffrey Epstein's death for official record-keeping purposes.

keyFacts: The Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) is formally requesting documentation to confirm Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Jeffrey Epstein is identified by the Florida criminal justice system with the identifier #76318-054.
At the time of the request (August 12, 2019), Epstein was still listed as a registered sexual offender in the state of Florida.
The document is an official administrative step to update Epstein's status in state records from 'registered sexual offender' to 'deceased'.
The request is dated August 12, 2019, which is shortly after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
